html: A Song of Salvation marks Jehovah’s deliverance of his people who acknowledge him as “our God”—their covenant Lord. The motif of “expecting” or “waiting” (qiwweh ) for Jehovah’s coming to deliver them defines the time of trial of his people’s faith that precedes his millennial reign (Isaiah 8:17; 26:2-4; 30:18; 33:2, 6; 35:3-4; 49:23; 64:4). Jehovah’s coming as salvation constitutes salvation itself: “Jehovah has made proclamation to the end of the earth: ‘Tell the Daughter of Zion, “See, your Salvation comes, his reward with him, his work preceding him”’” (Isaiah 62:11; emphasis added).
